ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : Atrial fibrillation , hypertension , epistaxis and history of cerebrovascular accident . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Ventriculostomy placement on 7/15/98 . ASSOCIATED PROCEDURES : Cerebral angiogram on 7/15/98 and flexible bronchoscopy on 7/16/98 and 7/27/98 . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : Mr. A was a 74-year-old right handed white male with a history of left middle cerebral artery cerebrovascular accident who on July 15th was asleep and awoke at approximately 1:00 AM with the worst headache of his life . Per his wife , the patient had been in his regular state of health except for complaints of a bifrontal severe headache . He had a photophobia and thereafter some nausea and vomiting . Per his wife , he was otherwise without any symptoms . He was taken first to Vaila Medical Center where he arrived at about 3:00 AM and a CT scan showed ? basal subarachnoid hemorrhage and hydrocephalus . He was loaded with Dilantin , placed on Decadron and transferred to the Ph University Of Medical Center . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Remarkable for cerebrovascular accident in 1994 . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Coumadin 3 mg. per day prior to admission . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : He was found to be an obese male with eyes closed . He was vomiting and sleepy . His vital signs were remarkable for a blood pressure of 195/100 . His mental status exam showed him to be very sleepy and he moved to sternal rub and loud voice . He was oriented to his name , Ph University Of Medical Center and 1997 and was able to follow simple commands . His motor exam showed a slight right drift and he was not cooperative with cerebellar testing . His physical examination also showed pupils at 3-2 mm. bilaterally and he blinked to threat . His INR was 3.8 on admission . SUMMARY OF LABORATORY AND RADIOLOGIC EXAMINATIONS : A CT scan on admission showed a pre-pontine subarachnoid hemorrhage with minimal spread to the sylvian fissure . He had significant hydrocephalus with a small intraventricular hemorrhage . HOSPITAL COURSE AND TREATMENT : Mr. A was admitted to the Neurosurgery Service with a diagnosis of subarachnoid hemorrhage and hydrocephalus . He was found to be unable to protect his airway , so was intubated in the emergency room . His anticoagulation was immediately reversed with FFP and he received several additional units of FFP during the hospital course . He had a cerebral angiogram performed on July 15th which was unrevealing . It showed no aneurysm and no dissection and no shunting lesions . He had a ventriculostomy placed by the Neurosurgery Service on July 15th . Mr. A was transferred to the Neuroscience Intensive Care Unit on July 15th . Neurologically , his lesions were inoperable , but he received treatment with Dilantin and the ventriculostomy tube to control his intracranial pressure . His neurological exam deteriorated over the first week of admission to the extent that he was at times responsive to voice by opening his eyes , but was not able to follow commands . He moved his left side more than his right side in response to stimulation . Cardiovascularly , he developed atrial fibrillation and hypertension during the hospital course and was managed by Dr. Gach of Cardiology . Infectious Disease issues included serial fevers of unknown source . Cultures from multiple sites never grew out any organisms . He was on antibiotics for several days while in Intensive Care . Gastrointestinally , he was unable to tolerate tube feeds and was started on total parenteral nutrition . Pulmonary wise , he was maintained on a ventilator throughout the hospital course until the day of expiration . Mr. A 's neurologic condition was stable at the baseline exam as described above . His family had a meeting with Dr. Liftjesc , Dr. Telshey Vital , and Dr. Tineara Rhalt of the Neurosurgical ICU . This meeting took place on July 30th from 10:00 AM until approximately noon . The family decided at this time that they wished to withdraw care from Mr. A . They wished that he be extubated and that all medical treatment except for comfort measures be pursued . Accordingly , the wishes of the family were attended to . At approximately 1:45 PM on July 30th , his ventriculostomy tube was discontinued . Shortly thereafter , his arterial line was removed . Following this , at approximately 2:05 PM , his endotracheal tube was removed . Mr. A immediately became bradycardic and desaturated . At 2:10 PM on July 30th , he expired . Mr. A , was immediately notified . She refused an autopsy and agreed to donation of needed organ or tissue . The Ph University Of Medical Center Admitting Desk was also notified as were Dr. Liftjesc , Dr. Telshey Vital , Dr. Azel Hibbskays , and the patient 's primary care physician , Dr. Tomedankell Flowayles .
